snippet: Researchers argue that in trying to attract larger audiences, network television tends to give more face time to good-looking lawmakers.
abstract: New research suggests that more physically attractive members of Congress get more coverage on network television; research is based on on a survey of students, who rated House and Senate members in 2007 on a scale of attractiveness; to avoid skewing the results, they eliminated, among others, members in top leadership posts and presidential candidates.
lead_paragraph: Researchers argue that in trying to attract larger audiences, network television tends to give more face time to good-looking lawmakers.

headline.main: Study Says Looks Matter as TV Covers Congress
headline.print_headline: Study Says Looks Matter As TV Covers Congress
